quest.name: Our Answer
journal: Fray was here long before you met.
Fray knows what is best for us, so we will do as shehe asks. We will wait for herhim outside the Gates of Judgement and say herhis name so shehe will know we are here.

A pair of knights hailing from Whitebrim Front overhear your summons and recognize you as the Warrior of Light. Seizing the opportunity to exploit the good nature of the fool who could not wait for herhis comrade and put this nonsense behind herhim forever, the knights convince you to help them deal with a band of giants. Head to Daniffen Pass and get it over with.
While your courageous new friends distract the dross, you will seek out and slay the leader. What a brilliant plan! Nothing like the countless other times we slew someone else's enemies.
You killed them. Well done. Can we go now?

Serve... Save... Slave... Slay... You struggle to hear the words of the knights over the pounding in your head. It would seem that Lord Drillemont has summoned you to Whitebrim Front to discuss allegations which have been made against you, including the rather disturbing charge that you were observed conversing with a corpse. Nothing for it, then. Journey to Whitebrim Front and kill them all.

Darkness dwells within us all, but few are forced to confront it as you are. One moment, Fray stands before you, and in the next, it is your twin. As you wrestle for control with your darkside, the voices of Whitebrim Front cry out to you in support, even as your own voice belittles your struggle. And then...as quickly as it began, it ends. Your soul is in your keeping once more.

By Lord Drillemont's command, none will speak of what they saw─a gesture you find more comforting with every passing moment. Even after regaining your faculties, your memories of Fray are still muddled...and though your darkside has been subdued, it remains your constant companion, yearning to be free. Yearning to set you free. You need only ask.

※The next dark knight quest is available from the unflinching Temple Knight in Whitebrim Front.
objectives: With the chat mode in Say, enter “Fray!” to call out to your comrade.
Speak with the unbending knight at Daniffen Pass.
Embrace the abyss! Set yourself free!

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: I knew you would come to your senses, Forename. Now, let us...let us go...

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: ...If I never see snow again, it'll be too soon.

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: We should go somewhere warm─at least for a little while...

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: Wait for me near the Gates of Judgement. When you are alone, call out and I shall join you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A moment later, Fray departs...though in what direction you cannot seem to recall...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter any phrase which includes “Fray” to attract herhis attention.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter any phrase which includes “Fray” to attract herhis attention.

dialogue.name: SAY
dialogue.text: Fray

dialogue.name: CAVALRYA02058
dialogue.text: (-???-)Wait, I know that voice! It's Forename Surname, the hero of the Scions!

dialogue.name: CAVALRYA02058
dialogue.text: Allow me to say what an honor it is to meet you, madamsir! I mean, by the Fury, the womanman who bested Shiva! Every knight under Lord Drillemont's command knows the tale!

dialogue.name: CAVALRYA02058
dialogue.text: I could go on, but, well...I'll just say it. If I may, madamsir─we need your help.

dialogue.name: CAVALRYB02058
dialogue.text: We've a giant problem, madamsir. A band of them has taken to raiding caravans passing through Daniffen Pass. We think they may be planning to expand their territory...

dialogue.name: CAVALRYB02058
dialogue.text: Lord Drillemont wants them gone, but you know how it is─too much work for too few hands. We'd need at least two dozen knights to clear them out safely...

dialogue.name: CAVALRYB02058
dialogue.text: But now that you're here, madamsir, we have nothing to fear!

dialogue.name: CAVALRYA02058
dialogue.text: Aye! While we create a distraction, you can slip past and put their leader down! Without him, they're sure to cut and run! So will you help us, madamsir?

dialogue.name: CAVALRYS02058
dialogue.text: (-House Durendaire Knights-)We beg of you!

dialogue.name: CAVALRYS02058
dialogue.text: (-House Durendaire Knights-)We beg of you!

dialogue.name: CAVALRYB02058
dialogue.text: Thank you so much, madamsir. We won't forget this!

dialogue.name: CAVALRYA02058
dialogue.text: Pray accompany me to the pass, madamsir. We can discuss the finer details of our plan there.

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: No... No more. Enough...

dialogue.name: CAVALRYA02058
dialogue.text: The leader should be somewhere in the tunnels, madamsir...

dialogue.name: CAVALRYA02058
dialogue.text: Once you are in position, we'll launch our attack. If all goes to plan, you should only have to contend with the leader and his guards. May the Fury guide and protect us!

dialogue.name: CAVALRYA02058
dialogue.text: We'll do our best to keep them distracted, madamsir!

dialogue.name: CAVALRYA02058
dialogue.text: By the Fury, you really did it! And you made it look so easy!

dialogue.name: CAVALRYA02058
dialogue.text: As for us─there were some injuries, but nothing serious. It was starting to look rather grim, actually...but the moment he fell, they sounded the retreat.

dialogue.name: CAVALRYA02058
dialogue.text: It was an honor to fight with you, madamsir! You really are everything the bards say.

dialogue.name: CAVALRYA02058
dialogue.text: Truth be told...I've been following your deeds for some time now...ever since you first came to Whitebrim Front.

dialogue.name: CAVALRYA02058
dialogue.text: Your martial prowess is widely known, of course, but what I found truly inspirational was your compassion for the common man.

dialogue.name: CAVALRYA02058
dialogue.text: How you would risk your life without thought for fame or fortune, how the lowest among us could find a friend in you...

dialogue.name: CAVALRYC02058
dialogue.text: (-???-)Sir, sir!

dialogue.name: CAVALRYA02058
dialogue.text: Is something wrong?

dialogue.name: CAVALRYC02058
dialogue.text: It's Lord Drillemont, sir. He heard we were in the field with Forename, and is demanding shehe come to Whitebrim Front at once!

dialogue.name: CAVALRYA02058
dialogue.text: Demanding!? What is the meaning of this!?

dialogue.name: CAVALRYC02058
dialogue.text: Certain...allegations have been made, sir. It would seem that shehe was observed conversing with...with a corpse in the Brume...

dialogue.name: CAVALRYC02058
dialogue.text: Not that anyone would ever believe such slander, of course...

dialogue.name: CAVALRYA02058
dialogue.text: Surely there is no need for concern. I mean, “conversing with a corpse”? What fools do they take us for?

dialogue.name: CAVALRYC02058
dialogue.text: I should warn you, madamsir, that some of these allegations were made by Temple Knights.

dialogue.name: CAVALRYC02058
dialogue.text: You, um...you may be asked to surrender your weapon...

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: Hah hah...“surrender your weapon”? After what happened in Ul'dah? They must be mad.

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: Pay attention, Forename. This could be the greatest moment of our life...

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: That is, if you could stop denying the truth that's been staring you in the face since the moment we met.

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: Say my name. Say it. My real name. Our real name!

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: Come now, you knew Fray was dead from the beginning, but you didn't care!

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: You had a sword and a soul crystal. But what you wanted was a mentor.

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: A mentor with the gifts and the knowledge. A dark knight who could guide you on the path─who you could aspire to become.

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: A womanman who was free to say and do the things you would not.

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: ...Even now, you continue to deny it. Well. Deny me all you want. You cannot deny what we have done.

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: Have I not been good to you? Have I not given you everything I promised?

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: Did I not help you to hear the whispers of our very soul!?

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: Open your eyes. Look. Do you see now? Do you see?

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-Forename Surname-)Everything up to now has been your story...

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-Forename Surname-)...And everything after now will be mine!

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-Forename Surname-)It would seem I underestimated myself... But no matter.

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-Forename Surname-)They have borne witness to the darkness within us...

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-Forename Surname-)To what lies beneath the mask...

dialogue.name: CAVALRY02058
dialogue.text: (-???-)Forename! Forename! Listen to us!

dialogue.name: CENOTA
dialogue.text: (-Cenota-)We will never forsake you! No matter what!

dialogue.name: CLOTAIRION
dialogue.text: (-Clotairion-)We know who you are, Forename! We know─and so do you!

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-Forename Surname-)A fantastic display of willful ignorance...

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-Forename Surname-)Wipe the slate clean. Forgive and forget!

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-Forename Surname-)Convince yourselves that shehe can be controlled...

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-Forename Surname-)The Warrior of Light! Our Weapon of Light!

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-Forename Surname-)It isn't too late, Forename. We...we can still be free...

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-Forename Surname-)Forename?

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-Forename Surname-)So this is your answer...

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-Forename Surname-)Listen to my voice. Listen to our heartbeat. Listen...

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-Forename Surname-)...If this is how it must be, then so be it.

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-Forename Surname-)But know that when you tire of this charade, I shall be here...waiting to take the reins...

dialogue.name: FRAY
dialogue.text: (-Forename Surname-)You need only ask...

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT02059
dialogue.text: I...I do not know what I just witnessed. Nor am I sure I wish to know...

dialogue.name: CAVALRYC02058
dialogue.text: Praise Halone you're all right, madamsir! For a moment, we feared we'd lost you forever...

dialogue.name: CAVALRYC02058
dialogue.text: Lord Drillemont made it clear that we will speak no more of what happened. Not that he had to ask, mind...

dialogue.name: CAVALRYC02058
dialogue.text: As for your...friend... I am told he will be interred with full rites. May his soul rest in peace...

dialogue.name: CAVALRYC02058
dialogue.text: ...Are you certain you are all right, madamsir? You seem a little... Never mind. Fare you well...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Fight, damn you! Fight!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Oh, look! You're doing it again! Bravo, Forename, bravo!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You can't really kill me, you know. Oh, you'll try. But you'll fail.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You may as well put the blade at your own neck. But where would that leave us, hmmm?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Pull yourself together, Forename! You are stronger than this!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Friends? Really? This is a private affair, and you know it.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: But carry on pretending otherwise, if it please.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Heh...things are certainly coming to a head, aren't they!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Do you have any idea how ridiculous you look? Flailing about like a wild beast in a battle against yourself!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: A house divided cannot stand, Forename!
